meanings.definition: The quality or state of being severable.
meanings.sent1: The severabilities of the fabric allowed it to be easily torn.
meanings.sent2: The engineer tested the severabilities of the material by cutting it with different tools.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved demonstrating the severabilities of the rope by cutting it and then magically restoring it.
meanings.sent4: The severabilities of trust between them were fragile, easily broken with a single lie.
meanings.sent5: The severabilities of the bond between the two friends were tested but ultimately proved unbreakable.

meanings.definition: The ability to be severed or separated.
meanings.sent1: The severabilities of the rope were evident as it easily broke under the weight.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the severabilities of the branches were tested as they were torn off the trees.
meanings.sent3: The severabilities of the cake layers made it easy for the kids to divide it equally.
meanings.sent4: The severabilities of the relationship became apparent when they decided to part ways.
meanings.sent5: The severabilities of the chain were so strong that even the strongest force couldn't break it.
